info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 3:14PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Moffat County through 345 PM MDT... At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 39 miles north of Dinosaur, or 43 miles northeast of Vernal, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Moffat County, including the following locations... Sparks. This includes Colorado 318 between mile markers 6 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
